Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the activity described in the informed consent form?
A) A routine medical check-up
B) A standard treatment program without any experimental procedures
C) A clinical research study comparing different treatment durations
D) A non-medical, personal survey

Correct answer: C) A clinical research study comparing different treatment durations

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary objective of the multicenter, randomized, open-label clinical study titled "Rezvilutamide 6-months Course Compared with Long-Term Androgen Deprivation Therapy (ADT) + Docetaxel Chemotherapy in High Tumor Burden Metastatic Hormone-Sensitive Prostate Cancer (mHSPC)"?
A) To determine the best surgical technique for prostate cancer treatment
B) To evaluate the cost-effectiveness of Rezvilutamide as a treatment option
C) To assess whether a 6-month course of Rezvilutamide is non-inferior to a long-term course in improving radiographic progression-free survival in patients
D) To compare the taste preferences of patients taking Rezvilutamide versus other medications

Correct answer: C

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the expected duration of participation for subjects in this clinical trial?
A) 6 months; B) Up to 12 months; C) 2 years; D) Indefinite until disease progression

Correct answer: B) Up to 12 months

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the costs that the subject may incur as a result of participating in the research?
A) The study will cover all medication, examination, and transportation costs for the subject.
B) The subject will be responsible for outpatient fees, transportation costs, medication costs, and examination fees.
C) The subject will receive a stipend to cover personal expenses during the study.
D) There are no costs associated with participating in the research; everything is covered by the study.

Correct answer: B) The subject will be responsible for outpatient fees, transportation costs, medication costs, and examination fees.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
Which of the following statements accurately describes the treatment procedures that participants will undergo in the study?

A) Participants will only receive ADT without any additional treatments.
B) Participants will be given a combination of Rezvilutamide, ADT, and Docetaxel for a period of 6 months.
C) Participants will be randomly assigned to either receive a 6-month course of degarelix with ADT and Docetaxel or a long-term course of degarelix with ADT and Docetaxel.
D) All participants will undergo surgical castration without the option of medication-based ADT.

Correct answer: C) Participants will be randomly assigned to either receive a 6-month course of degarelix with ADT and Docetaxel or a long-term course of degarelix with ADT and Docetaxel.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the study at any point after consenting to participate?
A) You will be required to reimburse the cost of any treatments received during the study; B) You will be barred from receiving any further medical care from the participating hospitals; C) You may withdraw without any impact on your future medical care or treatment options; D) You will have to pay a penalty fee for early withdrawal from the study.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the multicenter study on Rezvilutamide with ADT Plus Chemotherapy in High Tumor Burden mHSPC?
A) 50; B) 100; C) 150; D) 200

Correct answer: B) 100

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort that participants may experience during the study?
A) Increased energy levels and improved mood; B) Diarrhea and dehydration requiring intravenous fluids; C) Enhanced physical strength; D) Immediate cure of the disease

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What are the potential benefits of participating in the "Rezvilutamide 6-months Course Compared with Long-Term Androgen Deprivation Therapy (ADT) + Docetaxel Chemotherapy in High Tumor Burden Metastatic Hormone-Sensitive Prostate Cancer (mHSPC)" study?

A) Guaranteed cure for prostate cancer
B) Financial compensation for participation
C) Possible improvement in condition and contribution to medical research
D) Free long-term medical care for any condition

Correct answer: C) Possible improvement in condition and contribution to medical research

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
If you choose not to participate in the Rezvilutamide study, which alternative treatment options are available to you?
A) ADT monotherapy only; B) ADT combined with a non-specified second-generation anti-androgen therapy; C) ADT combined with abiraterone or ADT combined with docetaxel; D) No alternative treatments are available

Correct answer: C

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Who may have access to your personal health information if you participate in this study?
A) Only the research team at Jiangsu Provincial People's Hospital; B) Government authorities, hospital ethics committees, and other relevant researchers as regulated; C) All hospital staff members; D) The general public

Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What does the consent form state regarding compensation if a participant is injured as a result of the study?

A) Participants will receive financial compensation for participating in the study and additional compensation if injured.
B) Participants will not receive financial compensation for participating, but will receive treatment and compensation for injuries related to the study as per Chinese laws.
C) Participants will receive financial compensation for participating and for any injuries, regardless of their relation to the study.
D) The consent form does not mention any compensation or treatment if a participant is injured.

Correct answer: B) Participants will not receive financial compensation for participating, but will receive treatment and compensation for injuries related to the study as per Chinese laws.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding your participation in the clinical trial described in the consent form?

A) Participation in the study is mandatory once you sign the consent form.
B) You may face penalties or loss of benefits if you refuse to participate in the study.
C) You can withdraw from the study at any time without any penalties or loss of benefits you are otherwise entitled to.
D) If you refuse to participate, you will not receive any standard medical care.

Correct answer: C) You can withdraw from the study at any time without any penalties or loss of benefits you are otherwise entitled to.
